title: Firefox randomly fails to load certain websites
content:
Windows 10, Firefox 123.0 (64-bit)

It's so bad that I might have to stop using it entirely.

I've tried creating new profiles, disabling all add-ons, and disabling Enhanced Tracking Protection; none helped.

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1DX19hX88Hz_XUbsd0dAljiiiKY_XUUN_/view

As you can see in the video (about the 00:16 mark) it randomly stops properly loading pages from the website, even in new tabs. The only temporary remedy is to either close and re-open FF, or press Ctrl+F5 (which I did at the end of the video).

I must add that it can happen even when loading the website for the first time in the session.
creator: eddmann

title: Updates
content: My update preference for Firefox is to download but I will install it. But it consistenly (over the last numerous updates) changes it to Automatic. I do not want Automatic updates. I want to control when it updates. I do not see this issue addressed anywhere. I have checked numerous times. Please help! My sincere thank you for your time and attention to my request for help. Sincerely, Nicolas

title: why do my add-ons keep getting disabled?
content:
why do my add-ons keep getting disabled?

ff keeps disabling add-ons that i have used for years and even keep a v. 5 to use the older add-ons and use the latest ff developer to use w/ more modern websites. ff even disables add-ons that worked perfectly well in ff developer and does not even give me the opportunity to re-enable them like i could before.

is there any way to force my old version to let ME decide what i want disabled/enabled?
creator: digirl

title: JS.Heur.Calisto.2.7.4.E42F806.Gen downloaded with Ghostery update
content:
Hi

05.03.2024 - Ghostery notified me of an available update. Whilst the update was in progress it also downloaded JS.Heur.Calisto.2.7.4.E42F806.Gen. Fortunately, my antivirus software caught it and quarantined it. Can you explain why this was installed with a Ghostery update and please make others aware of this please?
creator: rorysherwood

title: oppen multiple tabs
content: Too often I will try to open multiple tabs from my bookmark tool bar and after opening 3 or 4 tabs no more will load. All I can do is reload Fire fox and start over. I have refreshed Firefox several times and it works for a while. If I use MS Edge it works fine every time. I really don't want to switch over to MS edge. Please help.
